issues.description: The attribute numberOfInscribedStudents is declared as long in the solution, but the UML in the problem statement specifies it as int, causing a mismatch in data type across artifacts.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the type of numberOfInscribedStudents in the solution (and template) to int to match the UML, or update the UML and problem description to long consistently.

issues.description: The constructor in the solution takes a long parameter for numberOfInscribedStudents, but according to the UML and problem instructions it should take an int.
issues.suggested_fix: Adjust the constructor parameter type for numberOfInscribedStudents to int in the solution (and template) to match the UML specification.

issues.description: The getter method getNumberOfInscribedStudents returns a long in the solution, but the UML specifies an int return type.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the return type of getNumberOfInscribedStudents to int in the solution to match the UML.

issues.description: The setter method setNumberOfInscribedStudents in the solution accepts a long parameter, but the UML and problem context expect an int parameter.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the parameter type of setNumberOfInscribedStudents to int in the solution to align with the UML.
